"Sophie," he began, timidly at first and then more and more boldly, "if you wish to refuse one who is not only a brilliant and advanta- geous match but a splendid, noble fellow . . . he is my friend ..."

"I have already refused," she said hurriedly.

S6nya again interrupted. She gave him an imploring, frightened look.
